channel.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
channel.description:
Just to spread the world to those who do not know yet, there is a group named Tripmine Studios that is doing the Opposing Force: Source named Operation Black Mesa mod.
You can find more info here: [url='https://www.moddb.com/mods/operation-black-mesa']MODDB[/url]
They are also doing the Blue Shift: Source named Guard Duty You can find more info here: [url='https://www.moddb.com/mods/guardduty']MODDB[/url]
They stated in Facebook that by the end of the year they will put the mods in Steam Greenlight, they will put Operation Black Mesa first and then Guard Duty.
[url='https://www.facebook.com/TripmineStudios']FB Page[/url]

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: The_Comedian
item.description:
They should hire a PR guy and leave to him the community updates […]

The thing is that we don’t want to give all our media/files to a person that only does the pr. We want to keep the persons with a copy of the mod at a very low percentage.

And keep an eye on our moddb pages in the near future …

Read full topic

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: elivance
item.description:
Xaeleep:

They should ‘hire’ a PR guy, with what money?

Money?
Who said money?

Look at nmrih dev team, they have a pr guy.
I seriously doubt that he get a dime for his “job”.

Edit: just checked on nmrih website: they have 2 pr

Read full topic

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: Blank
item.description:
What people don’t seem to realize is that, these things… they take time.

Nice Gabe Newell reference there.

elivance:

They should hire a PR guy and leave to him the community updates […]

They should ‘hire’ a PR guy, with what money? To hire someone that takes care of their news feed, makes sure that they don’t say or show off anything “bad” costs a ton of money. That’s just unrealistic.

Read full topic

item.description:
Pyro:

Maybe they’ll give you an update if you bribe them with a painting.

Keresh:

There’s gonna be an update soonishly™.

Awesome!

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: Dr_Maxwell
item.description:
Awesome! If OBM and GD are at a similar quality level to BM and some of the community projects I’ve seen around here (like the one guy completing Surface Tension by himself, he’s awesome, you should try to get him on your team if you need any more people and he’s willing), then I know that I’ll be, as the G-Man would say, impressed.

Read full topic

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: Keresh
item.description:
There’s gonna be an update soonishly™.

Read full topic

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
AndreeWallin:

I’m anxiously awaiting updates on this project, as well as Guard Duty. You gotta give us something soon, ok!?

Maybe they’ll give you an update if you bribe them with a painting.

Crypt19:

What people don’t seem to realize is that, these things… they take time. You can easily go months of working and not have anything notable to show for it. Time flies, and people get tired of the “we’re not dead” updates, because people complain that they have to prove it when they can’t because they’ve been working on smaller stuff that’s either not notable or no one cares about.

Also, they’d probably rather work then put together an update.

I agree. You’d think people on the Black Mesa forums, of all places, would understand this.

Read full topic

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: elivance
item.description:
Crypt19:

What people don’t seem to realize is that, these things… they take time. You can easily go months of working and not have anything notable to show for it. Time flies, and people get tired of the “we’re not dead” updates, because people complain that they have to prove it when they can’t because they’ve been working on smaller stuff that’s either not notable or no one cares about.

Also, they’d probably rather work then put together an update.

I disagree with you:
an important part of modding work(if we can call it so…) is create an a community around it.
They should hire a PR guy and leave to him the community updates and other stuff…
Imagine how many ways there are to involve a community:
community contest.
multiplayer meetings.
screenshots contest.
…

facebook it’s a powerful tool to get people involved.
They should take inspiration by nmrih and cof:

Read full topic

item.description:
They’ve got a forum. Maybe the devs post regular updates, much like another mod I followed. Everyone thought it was dead because they didn’t update anything, and only gave significant/extensive info through their forum. Forget the name, though.

item.title: Operation Black Mesa (Opposing Force: Source)
item.dc:creator: Suprememessage
item.description:
I thought Operation Black Mesa was dead because it hasn’t been updated in years. Maybe I missed an update since it has been several months since I last checked their mobdb. i assumed it was dead since the only info on it was one track from their soundtrack.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Unforeseen_Physics
item.description:
That isn’t too far from the truth. After Black Mesa released we had a HUGE influx of applications as well as a number of developers who used to be on the team come back to join. So we owe black mesa a great deal.

Spot on.
I’m one of those cases…

The BMS release did a lot of great things.
